Events that occurred on 17 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1954 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
1957 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Dr. Herbert Schiro (letter 203).
1957 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.
1968 – The Clouds Burst, the eighth and last episode of the 1968 radio series of The Hobbit, is aired on BBC Radio.
1996 – The website of Forodrim’s language guild, Mellonath Daeron, goes online.
2011 – The Lord of the Rings: War in the North is released in Brazil.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon. Approaching the Echoriad they avoid a band of orcs on the Old South Road.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
